photo.description: Chavin de Huantar site in the Ancash region of Peru. The Chavin culture (1000 - 30 BC) was the first major international empire/civilisation, stretching over many modern day countries, from Peru.

photo.description: One of the walls at Chavin de Huantar, which was built around 800 B.C. and is the only significantly sized structure remaining from the Chavin culture.

photo.title: Chavin de Huantar

photo.description: Casas en la Plaza de Armas del Pueblo de Chavín de Huantar, en la provincia de Huari, Ancash, en los Andes Peruanos. Chavín es el punto de partida para la visita de las ruinas del mismo nombre. ------------------------------------------------- Houses at the Main Square of the town of Chavin de Huantar, in the province of Huari, Ancashi, in the Peruvian Andes. This town is the gateway to visit the ruins of Chavin.

photo.description: Again, part of the pre-fight festivities. This is one of the loudest things I've ever heard/witnessed; they took a bunch of rockets and firecrackers, laid them out and then covered them in a long trail of gun powder. I swear.

photo.description: Vents that caused a loud roaring sound when hundreds (or possibly thousands) of gallons of water were poured into the underground channel. The purpose was to create a sense of "aw" and wonder and power by the priests.
